title: nf-core/circrna pipeline parameters
description: circRNA quantification, differential expression analysis and miRNA target prediction of RNA-Seq data

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and write results.

input.description: Path to directory containing FASTQ/BAM files or a CSV file containing the absolute path to FASTQ/BAM files.
input.help_text:
There are two ways to supply input data to nf-core/circrna:

1. Provide the path to the directory containing FASTQ or BAM files, with the appropriate wildcard glob pattern *e.g:*
```bash
--input "/data/*_r{1,2}.fastq.gz"
```
2. Provide a CSV file containing the absolute paths to FASTQ or BAM files *e.g:*

| Sample_ID    | Read1                          | Read2                          | Bam  |
|------------- |------------------------------- |------------------------------- |----- |
| control_rep1  | /data/control_rep1_r1.fastq.gz  | /data/control_rep1_r2.fastq.gz  | NA   |
| control_rep2  | /data/control_rep2_r1.fastq.gz  | /data/control_rep2_r2.fastq.gz  | NA   |
| control_rep3  | /data/control_rep3_r1.fastq.gz  | /data/control_rep3_r2.fastq.gz  | NA   |
| lung_rep1   | /data/lung_rep1_r1.fastq.gz   | /data/lung_rep1_r2.fastq.gz   | NA   |
| lung_rep2   | /data/lung_rep2_r1.fastq.gz   | /data/lung_rep2_r2.fastq.gz   | NA   |
| lung_rep3   | /data/lung_rep3_r1.fastq.gz   | /data/lung_rep3_r2.fastq.gz   | NA   |
| melanoma_rep1   | /data/melanoma_rep1_r1.fastq.gz   | /data/melanoma_rep1_r2.fastq.gz   | NA   |
| melanoma_rep2   | /data/melanoma_rep2_r1.fastq.gz   | /data/melanoma_rep2_r2.fastq.gz   | NA   |
| melanoma_rep3   | /data/melanoma_rep3_r1.fastq.gz   | /data/melanoma_rep3_r2.fastq.gz   | NA   |

 When supplying BAM files to the CSV file, set Read1 & Read2 columns to 'NA'.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved.

phenotype.description: Phenotype CSV file specifying the experimental design for DESeq2.
phenotype.help_text:
The response variable containing the phenotype of primary interest in the experiment must have the column name condition. An example phenotype file is given below:

| Sample_ID | condition | replicates |
|---------|-----------|------------|
| control_rep1  | control   | 1          |
| control_rep2  | control   | 2          |
| control_rep3  | control   | 3          |
| lung_rep1  | lung      | 1          |
| lung_rep2  | lung      | 2          |
| lung_rep3  | lung      | 3          |
| melanoma_rep1  | melanoma  | 1          |
| melanoma_rep2  | melanoma  | 2          |
| melanoma_rep3  | melanoma  | 3          |

This will produce the DESeq2 design formula '~ replicates + condition' i.e all columns not named condition will be controlled for in the linear mixed model.

pipeline_options.title: Pipeline Options
pipeline_options.help_text: Documentation for selecting circRNA quantification tools, analysis modules, outputs etc.

tool.description: Comma separated list of circRNA quantification tools to use. Supported tools: ciriquant, circexplorer2, find_circ, circrna_finder, mapsplice, dcc, segemehl
tool.help_text:
Select one or a combination of circRNA quantification tools for the pipeline e.g:
--tool 'circexplorer2, ciriquant, find_circ'

N.B: Selecting more than one circRNA quantification tool will trigger the circRNA filtering parameter --tool_filter

module.description: Comma separated list of modules to run: 'circrna_discovery', 'mirna_prediction' & 'differential_expression'.
module.help_text:
The 'circrna_discovery' module is mandatory. After circRNA quantification, the user can select 'mirna_prediction', 'differential_expression' or both to deploy additional analyses e.g:
--module 'circrna_discovery, mirna_prediction, differential_expression'

bsj_reads.description: Minimum number of reads spanning circRNA back-splice junction required for circRNA to be output by workflow.
bsj_reads.help_text: Filter low confidence circRNAs by removing circRNAs with read counts below a specified value. To disable, set the value to 0 (default).

tool_filter.description: Specify the minimum number of tools circRNAs must be called by to be output by the workflow.
tool_filter.help_text:
When multiple circRNA quantification tools have been provided to `--tool`, set a filtering method whereby circRNAs are output if they have been called by at least *n* quantification tools.

Setting `--tool_filter` to 0/1 is the same as taking the union, all circRNAs are included in the output.

Setting `--tool_filter` to 2 will output circRNAs that have been called by at least 2 quantification tools and so on.

Please note this is only reflected in the circRNA count matrix generated.

save_intermediates.title: Save intermediates
save_intermediates.description: Save intermediate files generated by various stages of workflow

save_reference.description: Save generated reference genome files to results.
save_reference.help_text: Saving generated references means that you can use them for future pipeline runs, reducing processing times.

save_qc_intermediates.description: Save output files from SamToFastq conversion, BBDUK trimming to results.

save_rnaseq_intermediates.description: Save RNA-Seq intermediates (Hisat2 BAM, StringTie outputs, DESeq2 results) to results
save_rnaseq_intermediates.help_text: note: nf-core/circrna performs DEA of both RNA-Seq and circRNA count data. Set True to save RNA-Seq differential expression results.

save_quantification_intermediates.description: Save intermediate files generated by circRNA quantiifcation tools to results.
save_quantification_intermediates.help_text: Save alignment files + raw tool outputs (useful if params.bsj_reads filter applied to counts).

save_mirna_predictions.description: Save miRanda, TargetScan prediction outputs to results.
save_mirna_predictions.help_text: By default, nf-core/circrna requires miRNAs to be called by both tools. Save intermediates to inspect raw results.

reference_genome_files.title: Reference genome files
reference_genome_files.description: Reference genome files supplied to the workflow.
reference_genome_files.help_text:
The workflow has been configured to use iGenomes and is thus the recommended route for nf-core/circrna.

Alternatively, the user must provide reference FASTA, GTF files at a minimum, miRbase mature.fa file for miRNA prediction and a species ID for differential expression analysis.

gtf.help_text:
If left empty, the parameter `--genome` must be supplied and the reference GTF file will be automatically downloaded.
```bash
--gtf "/reference/GRCh38.gtf"
```

*N.B:* The pipleine has been developed using reference files, UCSC/ENSEMBL files have not been tested.

mature.description: Path to FASTA file with mature miRNAs.
mature.help_text: Typically this will be the `mature.fa` file from miRBase. Can be given either as a plain text `.fa` file or a compressed `.gz` file.

species.help_text: Check conf/igenomes.config file & bin/ensemblDatabase_map.txt for inspiration..

bowtie.help_text:
Automatically generated if set to null. Alternatively, provide the absolute path to Bowtie indices directory e.g:
/data/reference_genome/BowtieIndex

bowtie2.help_text:
Automatically generated if left empty. Alternatively, provide the absolute path to the Bowtie2 indices directory e.g:
/data/reference_genome/Bowtie2Index

bwa.help_text:
Automatically generated if left empty. Alternatively, provide the absolute path to BWA indices directory e.g:
/data/reference_genome/BWAIndex

segemehl.help_text: Automatically generated if set null. Alternatively, provide path to Segemehl index file.

star.help_text:
Automatically generated if left empty. Alternatively, provide the absolute path to STAR indices directory e.g:
/data/reference_genome/STARIndex

igenomes_base.description: Directory / URL base for iGenomes references.

igenomes_ignore.description: Do not load the iGenomes reference config.
igenomes_ignore.help_text: Do not load `igenomes.config` when running the pipeline. You may choose this option if you observe clashes between custom parameters and those supplied in `igenomes.config`.

read_trimming_and_adapter_removal.title: Read trimming & adapter removal
read_trimming_and_adapter_removal.help_text:
BBDUK read filtering is deployed when `--trim_fastq true`. The user can choose to implement one or a combination of the following 3 operations performed by BBDUK:

1. Adapter removal. Must specify values for `--adapters`, `--k`, `--ktrim` & optionally `--hdist` 
2. Quality trimming. Must specify values for `--trimq` & `--qtrim` 
3. Read length filtering. Must provide value for `--minlen`

trim_fastq.help_text: If set to true, the BBDUK process is executed. If false, the BBDUK process is skipped and raw reads will be supplied to circRNA quantification tools.

adapters.description: Reference adapter file supplied to BBDUK
adapters.help_text:
BBDUK provides Illumina Truseq and Nextera adapters sequences in FASTA format suitable for most adapter removal situations. The adapters.fa file is located at "${projectDir}/bin/adapters.fa" should the user wish to modify the file. 

Make sure to specify the absolute path to the 'adapters.fa' file if modified.

k.description: Specifies K-mer size to use for adapter removal
k.help_text: 'k' specifies the kmer size to use (must be at most the length of the adapters). For example, `--k 32` removes all reads that have a 32 kmer match with the adapter sequences provided.

ktrim.description: Which end of reads to perform kmer trimming
ktrim.help_text: Specify which end of the reads to perform kmer trimming on. Options are 'r', 'l', and 'f' (right, left, don't trim).

hdist.description: Maximum Hamming distance for reference kmers
hdist.help_text:
Specify the number of mismatches allowed when aligning kmers to reference adapters. This paramter is optional for adapter trimming.

> Warning: setting `--hdist` to values higher than 1 will result in high memory usage.

trimq.description: Trimming performed on regions in reads with an average Phred score below specified value
trimq.help_text: > NB: This action is performed after adapter removal if specified.

qtrim.description: Which end of reads to perform quality trimming
qtrim.help_text: Used in conjunction with `--trimq`, performs quality trimming on the specified end of reads. Options are 'r', 'l' and 'rl' (right, left, both).

star_general.title: STAR
star_general.description: Define parameters for STAR 2 pass mode
star_general.help_text: STAR 2 pass mode is performed to identify novel splice sites in *all* samples. STAR takes the novel splice sites into account when performig re-alignment during the second pass. STAR is used for CIRCexplorer2, circRNA_finder & DCC

alignIntronMax.description: The maximum intron length is set to 1,000,000

alignIntronMin.description: The minimum intron length is set to 20. If the genomic gap is smaller than this value, it is considered as a deletion

alignMatesGapMax.description: The maximum genomic distance between mates is 1,000,000

alignSJDBoverhangMin.description: The number of minimum overhang for annotated junctions

alignSJoverhangMin.description: The number of minimum overhang for unannotated junctions

alignSoftClipAtReferenceEnds.description: Allow the soft-clipping of the alignments past the end of chromosomes

alignTranscriptsPerReadNmax.description: Max number of different alignments per read to consider

chimJunctionOverhangMin.description: Minimum overhang for a chimeric junction

chimScoreMin.description: Minimum total (summed) score of the chimeric segments

chimScoreSeparation.description: Minimum difference (separation) between the best chimeric score and the next one

chimSegmentMin.description: Minimum length of chimeric segment length, if == 0, no chimeric output
chimSegmentMin.help_text: Do not set to 0, this will disable outputs compatible with circRNA quantification.

genomeLoad.description: Mode of shared memory usage for the genome files
genomeLoad.help_text:
Users can select a variety of options depending on their resource configuration:

1. `LoadAndKeep`: load genome into shared and keep it in memory after run
2. `LoadAndRemove`: load genome into shared but remove it after run
3. `LoadAndExit`: load genome into shared memory and exit, keeping the genome in memory for future runs
4. `Remove`: do not map anything, just remove loaded genome from memory
5. `NoSharedMemory`: do not use shared memory, each job will have its own private copy of the genome

limitSjdbInsertNsj.description: Maximum number of junction to be inserted to the genome on the fly at the mapping stage, including those from annotations and those detected in the 1st step of the 2-pass run

outFilterMatchNminOverLread.description: Alignment output if ratio of matched bases relative to read length is equal to or higher than this value
outFilterMatchNminOverLread.help_text:
Consider 75bp paired end reads with sum matched bases of 120bp. Matched bp is summmed over combined read length (120/150 = 0.8). Simply put, lowering this ratio reduces the number of required matches in reads.

`outFilterMatchNminOverLread` is preferred over `outFilterMatchNmin` as it considers read length, suitable for experiments with varying read length.

outFilterMismatchNoverLmax.description: Alignment output if ratio of mismatched bases relative to **mapped** read length is lower than value
outFilterMismatchNoverLmax.help_text:
For example, for reads <20b no mismatches are allowed (1/19 = 0.0526), 20-39b: 1 mismatch, 40-59b 2 mismatches and so on. Simply put, increasing this value will allow for more mismatches in the mapped reads.

`outFilterMismatchNoverLmax` is preferred over `outFilterMismatchNmax` as it considers the mapped read length, suitable for experiments with varying read length.

outFilterMultimapNmax.description: Max number of multiple alignments allowed for a read: if exceeded, the read is considered unmapped

outFilterMultimapScoreRange.description: Score range below the maximum score for multimapping alignments

outFilterScoreMinOverLread.description: Alignment will be output only if its score relative to read length is higher than or equal to this value

outSJfilterOverhangMin.description: Minimum overhang length for novel splice junctions
outSJfilterOverhangMin.help_text:
4 integers: minimum overhang length for splice junctions on both sides for:
1. non-canonical motifs
2. GT/AG and CT/AC motif
3. GC/AG and CT/GC motif
4. AT/AC and GT/AT motif

-1 means no output for that motif

sjdbOverhang.description: Option to specify the length of the donor/acceptor sequence on each side of the junctions used in constructing the splice junctions database
sjdbOverhang.help_text: By default the option is set to 100. However, we recommend setting a value depending on the read length: read/mate length - 1

sjdbScore.description: Alignment score for alignmets that cross database junctions

winAnchorMultimapNmax.description: The maximum number of loci anchors that are allowed to map. By default, the pipeline uses a large number 999 to switch this filter off.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

name.help_text: A custom name for the pipeline run. Unlike the core nextflow `-name` option with one hyphen this parameter can be reused multiple times, for example if using `-resume`. Passed through to steps such as MultiQC and used for things like report filenames and titles.

email.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: This works exactly as with `--email`, except emails are only sent if the workflow is not successful.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.
plaintext_email.help_text: Set to receive plain-text e-mails instead of HTML formatted.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.
max_multiqc_email_size.help_text: If file generated by pipeline exceeds the threshold, it will not be attached.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.
monochrome_logs.help_text: Set to disable colourful command line output and live life in monochrome.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

tracedir.description: Directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

show_hidden_params.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested    for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.
custom_config_version.help_text:
Provide git commit id for custom Institutional configs hosted at `nf-core/configs`. This was implemented for reproducibility purposes. Default: `master`.

```bash
## Download and use config file with following git commit id
--custom_config_version d52db660777c4bf36546ddb188ec530c3ada1b96
```

custom_config_base.help_text:
If you're running offline, nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell nextflow where to find them with the `custom_config_base` option. For example:

```bash
## Download and unzip the config files
cd /path/to/my/configs
wget https://github.com/nf-core/configs/archive/master.zip
unzip master.zip

## Run the pipeline
cd /path/to/my/data
nextflow run /path/to/pipeline/ --custom_config_base /path/to/my/configs/configs-master/
```

> Note that the nf-core/tools helper package has a `download` command to download all required pipeline files + singularity containers + institutional configs in one go for you, to make this process easier.
